messages.message:
Sorry I'm late to this convo. I just ran into this warning in Build, and I think we need to update the copy there too. Here's what I recommend:

*Default drive has changed*
An admin changed the default drive for your organization. You must either migrate this project to the new default drive or delete it.
[Delete project] [Move project]

Please can we spare users the explanation of what a default drive is? Even I could not read all this copy!
@Arjun Can you update this modal for Build?
Yeah, I’m not worried about users not knowing what a default drive is. Users understand the concepts of both “drive” and “default”.

I'm fine with this copy and removing the default drive explanation if you believe users will know. This means:
1. Build: We need to update the modal with the proposed copy changes above. @Arjun I think we need your help here. 
2. Converse: We need to add a modal when the user first opens the project. They can close out of it and keep using the project. If they try to add files, I suggest the banner pops up. The user can close it and keep working (same behavior as we have). @Vasu I think we might need your help implementing these changes (new modal + copy changes to banner)

@hannah To clarify, would the user be able to add files after closing the banner or we expect the same behaviour as we have now (blocking uploads)?
cc @Rakesh @Balaram @Subash for the frontend changes
@hannah - Are we OK if these further changes make it to 24.02 release? What is the impact of this change currently?
